title: Test
yAxis: Average ticket price in U.S. dollars
summary: This line chart has an x axis representing Year and a y axis representing Average ticket price in U.S. dollars, with a total of 13 data points.
Overall Average ticket price in U.S. dollars has increased over the Year.
Average ticket price in U.S. dollars is slightly increasing from 2006 to 2008, slightly decreasing from 2008 to 2010, and lastly roughly constant from 2010 to 2019.
The steepest increase occurs in between the Year 2007 and 2008.
Max Average ticket price in U.S. dollars about 29.2 was recorded at Year 2008
Min Average ticket price in U.S. dollars about 21.52 was recorded at Year 2011
This line chart has an x axis representing Year and a y axis representing Average ticket price in U.S. dollars, with a total of 13 data points. The chart has 4 significant trends.
The longest trend is moderately increasing which exists from 2011 to 2016.
Likewise, the next significant trend is slightly decreasing which exists from 2008 to 2011.
On the other hand, the next significant trend is moderately decreasing which exists from 2016 to 2019.
Contrarily, the next significant trend is extremely increasing which exists from 2006 to 2008.
